page.title: 02LARNE - HOMES AND INDUSTRY
page.content: The{Craigy Hill}Housing Estate shows the typical street pattern of Sixties housing. Directly south is another new development,{Antiville.}The population is now concentrated in these estates with fewer people living in the centre of the old town. {Industry}is spread throughout the area and it was the growth of factories in Larne which produced the expansion of housing. This development was possible because of the facilities of the large {port of Larne}and the excellent link to Belfast and the airport by the{dual {carriageway} cutting across this zone. Within recent years industry has seen a recession but a growth of service industries and new recreational and social development. Most of the pupils in our school live in these estates.
